text: Jade Warrior Hero
A Jade Warrior soldier has earned the recognition of his comrades and superiors for his bravery in battle. Praise for this individual has reached your ears.
Reward this person
You personally pour a drink for this person and present him with the treasured sword you have carried for many years.
Promote this person
Such a warrior should be promoted to better serve Grand Cathay.
The soldiers are in high spirits, all eager to fight bravely.
The soldier will join your army as a Gatekeeper.
The Supreme Matriarch of Nan-Gau

The Great Bastion is complete, and the war is about to enter its next phase. The Supreme Matriarch of Nan-Gau, Miao Ying, arrives with her guards, weary from her journey. You keenly sense her gaze upon you, assessing you as one would a fine weapon. You have become the sharp blade she desires, pointed towards the north of the Great Bastion.\\nA military council is convened without any prior preparation. Cold, firm, and efficient - this is Miao Ying's usual style. And now, she wants to hear your proposal first.
Pincer Strategy

You believe that the Great Bastion garrison and Miao Ying's personal guards should be stationed separately, creating a pincer attack to disrupt the enemy's advance and retreat. At the same time, to fulfill this responsibility, the Great Bastion garrison needs more support.
Unite the Forces
The time is ripe. The northern armies should unite and launch a lightning attack, returning the pain inflicted by the Chaos enemy a hundredfold.
The Imperial Wardens faction remains independent, but you will receive continuous aid from Nan-Gau and form a military alliance with the Northern Provinces faction.
Confederate with the Northern Provinces faction.
Aid from Nan-Gau

A startled warhorse gallops through the camp, kicking over countless weapon racks and tents, sending soldiers scrambling in panic, forgetting all discipline. The Gatekeeper is furious and wants to restore order, but when he turns his head, he too is shocked. Outside the camp, a vast convoy of transport vehicles forms a human Great Bastion, the markings on the vehicles indicating they are from Nan-Gau.\\nThis event will trigger again after 15 turns.
Imperial Reinforcements
An elite reinforcement will play a crucial role in the battle.
Nan-Gau Armaments
Excellent equipment is a soldier's second life.
The Dragon Empress's Army
Miao Ying's army will become a sharp blade piercing the enemy's heart.
United as One
The Great Bastion and the Northern Provinces become one again, but the supreme glory of defeating the Chaos enemy will belong to the Protector General of the Northern Provinces.
An elite army will gather in Po Mu.
Obtain the Nan-Gau War Banner and Nan-Gau Shield.
Miao Ying's army appears near the faction leader.
Confederate with the Northern Provinces faction.
The Return of the Defier of Fate
Xin Wu has drawn enough power from his slumber. He has now returned and is willing to fight for Grand Cathay.
Join Forces Against the Enemy
The current Grand Cathay needs to seize every opportunity to restore peace. Even though Xin Wu's return may cause panic, you still hope he will become your ally.
Sword of Chaos

You have an excellent plan for Xin Wu: send him deep into the Chaos Wastes to disrupt the Chaos invasion army's assembly as much as possible with his killing. This also aligns with Xin Wu's own wishes.
For a period of time, Xin Wu will become your ally.
Great Bastion Threat: -20%
Defier of Fate
Army Ability: "Defier of Fate"\\n(Cathay-controlled regions)
Quell the Uprisings or Resist the Foreign Threat

While the Great Bastion remains calm, Grand Cathay is not at peace. You ponder whether to temporarily relieve Fu Yuanshan of his duties at the Great Bastion and entrust it to someone else, so he can help you quell the internal unrest within Cathay.
Prioritize Internal Stability
You intend for him to help you pacify Cathay first, then resist the foreign enemies later.
Resisting the Foreign Threat is Paramount
The great enemy of Chaos cannot be taken lightly for even a day. The minor unrest within Cathay can be easily quelled.
